<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_softirq_allocate:
```c
int metal_softirq_allocate(int num)
{
	int irq_base;

	if ((metal_softirq_avail + num) >= metal_softirq_num) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "No more available soft irqs\n");
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	irq_base = metal_softirq_avail;
	irq_base += metal_softirq_cntr.irq_base;
	metal_softirq_avail += num;
	return irq_base;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_softirq_allocate:
static int metal_softirq_avail
...

</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Only the two code regions above are flagged for investigation with respect to unreachable code: the conditional early-return block (which, if the condition is effectively always true due to configuration/initialization or integer overflow, would make the remainder of the function unreachable) and the allocation path that would be unreachable if the early-return is always taken. Other fragments are not reported because they do not themselves constitute unreachable code constructs: the local declaration (int irq_base;) is inert, and the metal_log call is a normal diagnostic call (its behaviour should be checked separately but the call site is not syntactically unreachable). The rest of the code is simple, conditionally reachable logic (either the function returns with an error or proceeds to compute and return irq_base), so there are no additional obvious unreachable-code fragments in the supplied function body.
